Dear Sir/Madam, On XX/XX/2018, I deposited a check number XXXX drawn on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX valuing {$4000.00} in my Chase checking account number ending in XXXX. I used Chase Bank ATM located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX NY. The check was accepted and I was informed that the funds will be available in my account on XX/XX/2018. I reside in XXXX, XXXX and had a scheduled flight from NY to XXXX. I returned to XXXX on XX/XX/2018. Later, I found that the check was not accepted due to ATM/deposit Error. In an effort to resolve the issue, I contacted Chase Bank via phone multiple times. The call center representatives came up with contradictory information every time. The details of my telephonic correspondence with chase is presented in an attached table. 

Finally, I traveled to New York on XX/XX/2018 to resolve this problem. I visited Chase Bank branch in the XXXX and personally met a banker on XX/XX/2018 to get a clearer picture. Even the banker in the branch was unable to help me and was astonished that they are unable to trace the original check. They suggested sending a copy of the check to the address of the party who wrote the check ( address was printed on the check ). I was informed that I shall have to wait 8-days for the check to be delivered to that address in NY. According to the banker, I must have received the copy of the check and updates about the problem much earlier. But even after the passage of around 3-weeks, the fate of this transaction in unknown. 

This ATM error and further mismanagement due to false and contradictory information presented by Chase Bank call centers has caused me a lot of mental and financial distress. I had to put my payments on hold resulting in accrued late payment fines from the creditors as well as loss of trust. It will also negatively impact my credit score. I had to travel to NY at the recommendation of the Chase Call Center representatives and the banker in the Chase Branch. And I am adding to my costs by staying in NY and waiting to receive updates from Chase. I request that either the check be returned to me promptly, or the amount be deposited in my account immediately. Further, I demand Chase Bank to compensate me for the financial and mental distress caused by their mishandling of the transaction as well as reimburse me for my stay in NY and travel between New York and XXXX. 

Thank you for your kind considerations.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently submitted a request for investigation of a which you refused. I submitted enough information for you to carry out a reasonable investigation of my dispute, since you obviously did not investigate this account thoroughly enough the last time I submitted one. They have already verified one of these fraudulent accounts and has removed that account. They have stated when I have called them, that they have contacted your agency numerous times to have the other account removed to no avail, often noting unreasonable hold times to get through to the fraud department. Experian will also not allow me to do these disputes online. 

If you had investigated properly, rather than use your XXXX system, you would have known, that not only have ever been late on this account, but that I am not the owner of this account, though your company claims to have verified this. 

It is at this time that I will point out that in XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Experian ), and XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, et al, the courts ruled each and every time that the CRA couldn't merely " parrot '' information from the creditors and collection agencies ... that they have to conduct an independent REASONABLE investigation to ensure the validity of the debt and the honesty/integrity of the creditor/CA in question. Sending out a generic form through the XXXX system that does not even contain my reasons for the dispute is not reasonable. 

Additionally, the following accounts do not belong to me and have been removed by the other credit bureaus and deemed fraudulent : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX If you do not initiate an investigation regarding my dispute, as is my right under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I will have to take legal action to protect my credit rating and myself. As Im sure you are aware, each violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act allows damages of {$1000.00} should this matter end up in court.

A few months ago, I was advised that the web site for managing my Suntrust mortgage account ( https : //suntrustmortgage.customercarenet.com ) was being retired in favor of suntrust.com effective XX/XX/2019. 

The " old '' site displays this message : Please enroll in Online Banking at suntrust.com to continue to manage your mortgage online. 
You will need to create a new userID and password using your mortgage account number ( if you do not have it handy, you may log in below and locate it before leaving this site ).

When I try to log onto the new site, I get error messages indicating that my records can not be matched. I am advised to contact Suntrust by phone, but have never been able to reach a human being to help me with my issues.

I am now afraid that ( 1 ) my loan servicing will be continued electronically despite the change in parameters, and that ( 2 ) I will stop receiving important information, notifications about my account, and the ability to manage my account without a lot of effort in dealing with Suntrust 's failure to manage my records and transfer them correctly to their new system. If they can not do something as simple as linking my account information so that I can open an online account as they have instructed, I have no basis for believing that they are recording or applying my payments correctly, either.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: There are many mistakes appear in my report without my understanding.

On XX/XX/2019 I received an email from PNC Bank XXXX my mortgage servicer ) stating that my automatic payment of my mortgage was processed, however I noted the amount was double that of my mortgage payment. I verified with my checking account that two payments were removed on XX/XX/2019. One of which was the authorized mortgage amount of {$2000.00}. A second, unauthorized payment was also processed from my bank account in the amount of {$2000.00}. 
I then attempted to login to my online banking account and was found that I was locked out of my online banking portal with PNC bank. Therefore I could not verify my loan payments having been made and received. 
I then called PNC bank and spoke with a customer service rep ( XXXX ), he alerted me that PNC was aware of the situation and I had two courses of action, 1. receive a mailed check in the amount of my duplicate payment, this check would take 10-14 days via mail. 2. I could go through the verified process to receive a wire transfer in the amount of the duplicate payment. I told him that I could not wait 10 days to receive my funds back and that this was an unauthorized payment made to PNC that they needed to fix this problem. He alerted me that my only other course of action would be to call my personal bank and stop payment on the second unauthorized amount. 
I then called my personal bank, they told me the funds could not be stopped on their end but they were still pending and there was no reason PNC bank could not cancel the transaction in order for my funds to not be taken out of my account. 
- I called PNC bank back, I spoke with XXXX who gave me the same 2 courses of action as I was originally told. When I asked him to simply cancel the second unauthorized payment he told me that PNC bank does not cancel payments ... .. I escalated to his supervisor ( XXXX ) she verified that PNC bank would not cancel the payment on their end, she alerted me that " upper management '' is aware of the situation, she did not know how they would return my funds or when I would receive them but I was to trust her in knowing that they are working on it and my funds would be returned. I asked how they would correspond with me going forward, and she said they would not initiate any communication, I would need to call back to find out more information about my funds. Meanwhile, PNC bank has {$2000.00} of my money that I did not authorize them to take from my account and I have no repercussions in knowing when they will be returned to me, if I will have my funds to pay the rest of my bills for the month and feed my family and I am left with no answers as to when or how my money that they took from me will be returned.

I have a Mortgage with CitiMortgage. It is for a condo in XXXX XXXX XXXX, SC. I have had this Mortgage for 12 years. This condo requires Flood Insurance. The condo association is required to provide Flood Ins. Citibank and the insurance company communicate every year to confirm. This year they did not communicate. Citibank purchased Flood insurance for the unit in addition to the normal Flood Insurance I get through the association. They added an escrow to my account. Thats when I had to get involved. I connected with the Insurance group at Citibank. They provide an online portal to up load documents. I provided the information via the upload site. Citibank never received. Today, Citibank admitted that the site sometimes does not work. If you try to upload the same document twice, it will say it uploaded successfully, when it does not. Normally, I do not have to get involved at this level. We did not pay the escrow, and Citibank put a credit alert to my credit bureau that I had missed a payment. This was incorrect, we have paid every month on time. I am not sure if this practice is legal or ethical. Citibank is does care, and is requesting more fees and escrow payments even when they have proof of insurance.

Hello, We received a check from someone who we thought wanted to stay in our rental unit. That individual claimed that the check came from their place of business and that they accidentally sent too much money as some was intended for their travel agent. They asked us to refund a portion of the check to their travel agent. 

We waited until Chase confirmed that the deposit was accepted and then refunded a portion of the check to the individual via Chase XXXX ( XXXX ). The individual then stated that a work obligation came up and they would no longer be able to stay in our rental unit. We then refunded them an additional portion of the check via Chase XXXX as Chase had shown the funds were available and I never received a message from Chase that there was a bounced check. 

Unfortunately, I now come to discover that the check had bounced. I am shocked, disappointed, and angry that Chase did not immediately notify me that the check had bounced. As someone who has never bounced a check, this should have been setting off alarms at Chase and they should have contacted me via phone, email, text, or anything to notify me. I did not even receive an internal message when I log in that the check had bounced. 

I called Chase 's fraud & claims department and they were not willing to assist me at all. I spoke with XXXX and he was not helpful or sympathetic to my matter. In total, we were defrauded out of {$3000.00} between 3 payments via Chase XXXX. Chase 's current policies and customer service will continue to help criminals while hurting and angering their loyal customers. Chase should have immediately warned me that the check had bounced and I would have been able to help prevent additional fraudulent activity. Chase also should not have shown the check 's funds as available only to have it bounce later on. 

{$3000.00} is not a material amount of money to Chase, but to my wife and I, who are loyal Chase customers, it is.

I opened a CD with capitalone bank with an amount of XXXX for a year, at the interest rate of 2.7 %. Upon reaching maturity, I was not paid out the correct amount. The total amount came out to be XXXX instead of XXXX, short of {$53.00}. 
Upon complaining, the support team kept arguing and giving me a formula to calculate and even after applying that formula, the interest rates didn't add up ( formula given [ balance x interest rate ] ) /365 ( 366 for leap year ) x days in a month ). 
When I responded saying, the results do't add up still, the agents kept saying they can only give formula and can not verify the interest and said they would put in a request for it to be verified, but the amount was never verified or any explanation given. I felt cheated out of the amount owed as if I had defaulted on my cd they wouldn't refrain from withdrawing a penalty, but when they are at fault, they refuse to correctly pay out the amount promised.

When asked for information why it has happened, the answer was that this score is based upon XXXX  report. I called XXXX and they denied providing such a wrong information. At this moment am disputing this sudden drop of the score and I am asking removal of such inquiry. 
As far as I know, the official credit bureaus are the only providers of credit information. Many new providers of scores are doing it for less money and are increasing the market. Their information is not always correct. They maybe are pleasing the lenders who are paying for information, but it can create harm to customers - intentionally or inadvertently. 
I am informing CFPB because this has happened under your watch of the compliance with FDCPA.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: i am XXXX years old. i started using credit at XXXX when i bought my first car and since have owned numerous credit card accounts - home loans - lines of personal credit etc.. for over 40 years - several years ago - my wife and i of XXXX years marriage - divorced and i closed all of my accounts - since then i have opened several accounts -so all of my current open credit is about XXXX years old - the problem is that the formula the 3 credit reporting agencies use to define the length of time i have had credit key on the oldest start date of all of my open credit accounts thus reporting that i have only had credit for a couple of years -- this is hurting my credit score as the time i am reported as having credit to my name is only XXXX years - this is not a good thing because it shows i am very new to managing credit. this is a flaw in the formula - i have had credit for over 45 years but they all three report that i have only had credit for a couple of years. i disputed this with all three but they will not change my score or the length of time i have managed credit. this is not a true representation and is hurting my score and causing me to have problems getting a mortgage. they need to fix this so the length of time is not a couple of years. this puts me in the same group as a teenager just starting out in life.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It may concern. XX/XX/XXXX I made a big mistake in XX/XX/XXXX. I had let some credit cards get out of hand, and I was looking at paying them off. 
Somehow, I got a message from XXXX XXXX about that time, Erase your credit card debt. I made the mistake of contacting them. They were talking about a " negotiated settlement, '' which sounded pretty good. When they told me to stop making payments, I told them that would ruin my credit. They said that no one would negotiate unless the account was delinquent. They said that it would be very easy to clear my credit rating when they finished. 
Im sure you have heard this story before. I ended up with a high-interest loan for what they paid on the credit cards. Then I got a XXXX Tax form ( Earnings statement ) from the credit cards for the unpaid balance, and paid tax on it. I could have paid off the cards for what it cost me. 
I have endured the consequences for 7 years because I felt that I had created the problem, out of my own ignorance. 
It has been over 7 years, and I am still paying exorbitant interest rates, except on my VA loan. 
You can see that I am paying all of my debts on time, and I can lower the balances, if I can lower the interest rate. Currently, I see nothing on my credit report that I can protest. 
Please, just point me in the right direction to resolve this problem. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC is trying to collect a debt I do not owe for a purchase I made through XXXX XXXX. Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC claims to be the owner of the debt. 
-XX/XX/XXXX : Check written to XXXX XXXX for {$8300.00} for a furniture purchase. 
-XX/XX/XXXX : Check was processed by XXXX XXXX XXXX Deposit ( XXXX XXXXXXXX 's Bank ). An encoding error was made by entering the amount erroneously as {$8300.00} ( {$.00} less than the check was written for ). 
-XX/XX/XXXX : Check was processed a second time by a separate entity, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX 's Bank ), for the correct amount of {$8300.00}. 
-XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX XXXX ( my bank ) reversed the second transaction since the check was already processed. Letter was sent from XXXX XXXX to me explaining the reversed transaction. Due to XXXX XXXX 's encoding error, they were paid {$.00} less than the check was written for. My Bank ( XXXX XXXX ) can not do anything about the {$.00} variance. XXXX XXXX must initiate the process of collecting the remaining {$.00} through XXXX XXXX 's bank. 

XXXX XXXX sold a debt of {$8300.00} to Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC. Certegy Payment Solutions has been trying to collect this debt since XX/XX/XXXX. Certegy Payment Solutions has also hired a separate debt collector, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, who is also sending letters trying to collect this debt. 

In summary, XXXX XXXX sold a debt for an amount that was incorrect in violation of the FDCPA. Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX are trying to collect a debt I do not owe in violation of the FDCPA. 

I am attaching these letters sent by certified return receipt mail : -XX/XX/XXXX letter to Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC -XX/XX/XXXX letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
-XX/XX/XXXX letter to Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC -XX/XX/XXXX letter to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
-XX/XX/XXXX letter to Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC I am also attaching 2 additional letters received from Certegy Payment Solutions after my last letter sent XX/XX/XXXX. Based on the content of these 2 letters it is clear Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC has all the documentation to prove I do not owe this debt. They are now crossing a line into harassment.

-JXX/XX/XXXX letter where Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC is now requesting that I prove to them that the check I wrote has cleared my bank twice. This constitutes misleading and unfair debt collection practices since what they are asking for has not happened. The check cleared once, and XXXX XXXX has been paid. If the check cleared my bank twice, I would have paid twice the amount the debt was owed, and therefore XXXX XXXX would owe me {$8300.00}. 
-XX/XX/XXXX letter where Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC is ignoring a letter sent from my financial institution ( XXXX XXXX ) stating the check has been processed through my account. Certegy Payment Solutions , LLC has continually requested contact information for my financial institution, which I have provided. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/2018 I applied for a credit card and was denied because my information did not match my SS number. I was told by Equifax that one number was off. I faxed and mailed my identification ( total of 3 times ). I received a credit report stating I was also known as a woman ( I am a XXXX year old man, XXXX at the time in question ), in a different state with multiple accounts that were not mine. I filed the dispute paperwork online and mailed in a copy. I received multiple emails from Equifax stating the dispute was resolved with instructions to access it online. However, I can not access it online because I get an error stating the information does not match. I have called numerous times, all I want is an updated copy of my credit report because I am afraid it was not corrected properly since I am unable to access it online. I have emailed Equifax numerous times and am told to call customer service. Everytime I call, I am put on hold only to be told their computer system is down. All I want is a copy of my credit report and I seem unable to get it. The other credit reporting agencies had my information correct.

I have disputed with a collection agency by the name of Diversified Consultants stating an inaccurate entry of an account on my credit report by their company. They have made a claim stating that I am  obligated to pay the amount {$390.00} which I do not. 

I have reached out to them on XX/XX/2019 and XX/XX/2019 requesting again to provide me with a copy of any viable evidence, bearing my signature, showing the account is being reported accurately and that I have an obligation to pay them. They have failed to submit any contractual agreement with my signature with Diversified Consultants. As per the FTC opinion letter from Attorney XXXX XXXX XXXX, a printout of a bill or itemized document does not constitute verification. 

According to FCRA & FDCPA, it is in violation to report any inaccuracy on a consumer credit report if there is no validation of the debt, they must request that all crediting reporting agencies delete the entry. 

I am again formally requesting a copy of any documents, bearing my signature, showing that I have legally binding contractual obligation to pay you the alleged amount. 

Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person who personally verified this alleged account, so that I can inquire about how they verified without providing any proof, bearing my signature. 

Be aware that I am making a final goodwill attempt to have you clear up this matter. The listed item is entirely inaccurate and incomplete and represents a very serious error in your reporting.

I ADDED COUPLE OF AUTHORIZED USERS TO MY CREDIT CARD IN THE HOPE OF HELPING FAMILY & FRIENDS TO BUILD THEIR CREDIT WHICH IS COMPLETELY LEGAL UNDER THE CONSUMER LENDING LAW. IT IS STATED IN THE FDIC LAW SECTION 226.12 STATES Persons to whom cards may be issued. A card issuer may issue a credit card to the person who requests it, and to anyone else for whom that person requests a card and who will be an authorized user on the requester 's account. In other words, cards may be sent to consumer A on A 's request, and also ( on A 's request ) to consumers B and C, who will be authorized users on A 's account.I received a call from the USAA financial dispute department stating that i am being investigated for what? idk, she claims i have a lot of people added on my account and all these people are only authorize users just helping my friends and family to give them a little credit boast which all credit card company promote. I have researched and read through a lot of book to find any credit act stating adding authorized user is not allowed. I have been a customer for over 5 years and i have maintain a great financial history, never missed a payment and 100 payment history with USAA. My checking account is been frozen and i am getting a bill from USAA for the past 2 months for over 5 loans and credit card that i have with them not considering the fact that my funds are held my them. I need all my funds released and all my account reinstated cause USAA are violation of my consumer right. EC. 101. PROTECTION OF CREDIT CARDHOLDERS. ( a ) ADVANCE NOTICE OF RATE INCREASE AND OTHER CHANGES REQUIRED. ( 1 ) AMENDMENT TO TILA.Section 127 of the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1637 ) is amended by adding at the end the following : ( i )  ADVANCE NOTICE OF RATE INCREASE AND OTHER CHANGES REQUIRED. ( 1 ) ADVANCE NOTICE OF INCREASE IN INTEREST RATE REQUIRED.In the case of any credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan, a creditor shall provide a written notice of an increase in an annual percentage rate ( except in the case of an increase described in paragraph ( 1 ), ( 2 ), or ( 3 ) of section 171 ( b ) ) not later than 45 days prior to the effective date of the increase. ( 2 ) ADVANCE NOTICE OF OTHER SIGNIFICANT CHANGES REQUIRED.In the case of any credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan, a creditor shall provide a written notice of any significant change, as determined by rule of the Board, in the terms ( including an increase in any fee or finance charge, other than as provided in paragraph ( 1 ) ) of the cardholder agreement between the creditor and the obligor, not later than 45 days prior to the effective date of the change. ( 3 ) NOTICE OF RIGHT TO CANCEL.Each notice required by paragraph ( 1 ) or ( 2 ) shall be made in a clear and conspicuous manner, and shall contain a brief statement of the right of the obligor to cancel the account pursuant to rules established by the Board before the effective date of the subject rate increase or other change. ( 4 ) RULE OF CONSTRUCTION.Closure or cancellation of an account by the obligor shall not constitute a default under Deadline. Deadline. 15 USC 1602 note. 15 USC 1602 note. VerDate Nov 24 2008 19:26 Jun 01, 2009 Jkt 079139 PO 00024 Frm 00003 Fmt 6580 Sfmt 6581 E : PUBLAWPUBL024.111 PUBL024 kgrant on POHRRP4G1 with PUBLIC LAW 123 STAT. 1736 PUBLIC LAW 11124MAY 22, 2009 an existing cardholder agreement, and shall not trigger an obligation to immediately repay the obligation in full or through a method that is less beneficial to the obligor than one of the methods described in section 171 ( c ) ( 2 ), or the imposition of any other penalty or fee. my credit card were cancelled without notice and my bank accounts were also frozen without notice. My online access was restricted and keeping up with all my loans and bills with USAA is been tremendously difficult has i have other accounts and business account to deal with. I need proof stating i am in violation of my credit card usage and i am open to escalating even if it requires going to court. I have contacted my attorney and if this matter is not resolved 10 business days we will be pressing charges for consumer right violation.

Vanderbilt mortgage pro-actively reached out to me to suggest a disaster relief plan that would have me defer three months payments. They told me to skip three months payments and then on the 4th month they gave me a new amount that I would be required to pay for 6 months. ( this amount represented my normal monthly amount plus an additional amount to make up for the three months by spreading it out over 6 months ). I did everything that Vanderbilt told me to do. I skipped the three payments and I set up by automatic bill pay with the bank to pay a higher amount for 6 months and then resume with my normal monthly payments. 

I was never any days late.

They did report me as late.. .however, I never missed nor was late on any payments with Vanderbilt mortgage.

I currently have a LTV of 78.00 % on my current home mortgage. I have requested the private mortgage insurance to be cancelled. The loan servicer, ( Chase Home Mortgage ), the PMI company ( XXXX XXXX ) and the loan holder ( XXXX XXXX ) are requiring me to get a BPO ( Brokers Price Opinion ) which costs {$100.00} for determination that my house has not decreased in value. 

Per the HPA ( Homeowners Protection Act ), when a homes LTV reaches 78 % of the original mortgage amount the loan servicer has to request the PMI be cancelled. Chase Mortgage will not request the PMI to be cancelled unless a BPO is obtained. I am being penalized by paying extra on my mortgage to get the PMI cancelled earlier than the predicted amoritization date of when my LTV would be 80 % which was predicted to be XX/XX/XXXX. 

Furthermore, if i had not been forward thinking and not checked on this my PMI would have been automatically canceled in XX/XX/XXXX, however my LTV would have most likely been around 70 % at that point. I would not have received a refund on the PMI that was not required to be paid based on I reached a LTV of 78 % in XX/XX/XXXX. I would have paid approximately an extra XXXX on PMI that was not required and that should have been cancelled automatically when my LTV reached 78 %.

I've been a borrower of theirs for over two years and have not yet paid half to the principal, and have reached out to them with major issues to break down into detail about where my own money was going towards. I have politely asked for refinancing options as well, but was denied this. I have asked for Extended Payment Plan, which they had charged an additional 5 % without notifying me, and the representative over the phone never clarified to me. My auto loan borrowed was initially {$12000.00} to finance for 60 months. I've closed my credit accounts to pay for this auto loan that is clearly a depreciating asset, but none of my money has gone towards the principal of this car. I've kept in contact with Santander about my situation in hopes that our business could become better, but I honestly feel a deep disrespect from the lender as I've tried my best to be cordial. On XX/XX/XXXX on a Thursday evening, I've called to manage my past due balance to bring my account back to current, and was told by 2 separate representatives an amount of {$620.00} made before XX/XX/XXXX would bring my account back up to current. I was not told of any other late fees that would be charged onto my account. Today, XX/XX/XXXX, I called to confirm this amount and was actually charged an additional {$260.00} onto my account, which was only three business days, and after speaking with a representative and a Supervisior who've clarified the additional charge. I asked to be waived of these extra charges because I was not given this information, and was again denied. If there is a reason for my default, I believe that Santander is in exploit of that. I am not satisfied as a consumer and would like to report this scandal. If Santander strives to be a company of prosperity and respect, they wouldn't dig a deeper threshold for their own consumers. Files will not be included until I receive an e-mail via CFPB. Thank you for your time!

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
THIS COMPANY HAS REPORTED A NEGATIVE AND INVALID COLLECTION ACCOUNT ON MY CREDIT REPORT CAUSING SEVERE DAMAGE TO MY CREDIT SCORE STOPING ME FROM PURCHASING A HOUSE AND I NEED IT REMOVED IMMEDIATELY! 
THIS IS MY SECOND TIME CONTACTING THIS COMPANY AND YOU GUYS HAVE NOT FIXED THE ISSUE. For months this company has been reporting inaccurate, unverifiable, erroneous things on my credit report and I am sick of it!! This company is reporting NEGATIVE and INVALID information on my credit report and is severely affecting my credit score.  The account information that this company is providing can not be proven because they do not have the original signed document saying that I owe them a debt which is A direct violation of my CIVIL RIGHTS according to the FCRA section 609. This company must remove their account from my credit reports immediately and permanently. A DELETION OF THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CREDIT REPORT IS A FAIR RESOLUTION. Please be advised I have requested validation { not verification } of an item reported to you by the above original creditor/collection agency. I have received a response that does not indicate or prove : 1. I had this service. 2. What services I am being charged for. 3. What the cost of each service I am being charged for. I will proceed with legal action as prescribed by law against the above-named original creditor/collection agency. Should this item not be deleted within the required time allowed by law I will seek every legal remedy available to me and file suit against the credit bureau responsible for reporting this violation. I urge you to take this extremely seriously as I have documented my case without error. I encourage a response from you expeditiously.

Good Evening ; I was going through my credit report after receiving several aggressive calls from a debt collector company about an alleged debt. I went ahead and paid, but I keep reviewing my credit report it shows on my credit with a balance of over {$200.00} ... .I 've asked them and the credit bureaus to please clarify the payment status, comments, balance and account number as they might be erroneous. 

Also I have disputed this item with the credit reporting agency and they reported you confirmed the account as valid. I honestly do not believe to ever have any relationship with this collection agency or original creditor. 

Also there are several inaccuracies with this account the way it's reporting and that's a total violation of FCRA and FDCPA laws and regulations. In a good faith effort to resolve the matter amicably, I must demand proof of this debt, specifically the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature, as well as proof of your authority in this matter. Absent such proof, you must correct any erroneous reports of this past debt as mine. I am writing to request that you please provide the following information : 1.  Please evidence your authorization under 15 USC 1692 ( e ) and 15 USC 1692 ( f ) in this alleged matter. 2. What is your authorization of law for your collection of information? 3. What is your authorization of law for your collection of this alleged debt? 4. Please evidence your authorization to do business or operate in this state. 5. Please evidence proof of the alleged debt, including the alleged contract or other instrument bearing my signature. 6. Please provide a complete account history, including any charges added for collection activity

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My husband, XXXX XXXX, and I leased a XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX in XXXX, OH on or about XX/XX/XXXX. This was a two year lease, expiring on XX/XX/XXXX, so we traded it in to XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX in exchange for a XXXX XXXX XXXX. We made our last payment for the XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, and paid the amount owed for the XXXX at trade in ( see the bank statements, attached ). 

On or about XX/XX/XXXX, we received a bill from GM Financial for payments on the XXXX allegedly owed in XXXX and XXXX of that year. We contacted our salesman at XXXX, sent in the vehicle return receipt to GM Financial, and believed that the dealership and GM Financial had worked things out. We didnt receive any more bills after that. 

As you will see from my attached letter, they had not resolved this billing issue, and our credit scores dropped approximately 50 points over the XXXX holiday. I filed a dispute with XXXX  in XXXX of XXXX. The balance was changed to {$0.00}, but issues remained. 

Ultimately, I filed a second dispute in XXXX since our scores did not recover, and I still had late payment status showing on my credit report ( attached ). 

This dispute was not corrected, and this issue became known in the course of applying for a home equity line of credit from XXXX XXXX this week ( also attached ). I  contacted XXXX today, they confirmed that these amounts were past due, and they ultimately sent me to GM Financial. GM Financials Loss Prevention rep ( XXXX ) reviewed my account, confirmed that they were still looking for these two payments, and directed me to the dealership. My question to both was how is it possible that we could owe payments on a vehicle that was in legal possession of the manufacturers dealership/ financial arm? I had sent both parties evidence of our non-possession of the XXXX in XXXX, yet this report stood. In both cases, the parties pointed me elsewhere. XXXX was unwilling or unable to help me beyond that point. 

I then left a message for the general manager at XXXX XXXX hours ago, with no response so far. 

Please help. At no point did any of these companies take any accountability regarding this mistake that one of these parties made, and it is negatively impacting us, despite our best efforts to be as fiscally responsible as possible. 

Thank you so much for reading this complaint. If you have any questions, please call. XXXX. 

Best, XXXX XXXX

XXXX sold their XXXX  accounts to Citibank. When I saw the notification in XX/XX/XXXX, I called XXXX and told them not to automatically renew the membership on that card as I did not want a new credit card or company as I was living overseas and did not need the XXXX membership anymore. ( I was home stateside on holiday when I saw the mail notification and called immediately ). I told the customer service rep that I did not call the number to activate the card and was cutting it up as we were speaking and the gentleman told me it was taken care of. The account would be closed. When I returned to the States in XX/XX/XXXX, I see in my junk mail pile envelops from Citibank. I opened one assuming it was the standard " come back to us '' bulk mailings and saw it was an outstanding bill for the {$60.00} XXXX renewal in XX/XX/XXXX plus interest and late fees amounting to a total of {$280.00}. I immediately called XXXX customer service who told me they could not help and I had to call Citibank. I called Citibank and they said I had to write the dispute department ( US mail or Fax only ) and they they would NOT have anyone reach out to me as it was my issue to resolve. The gentleman ( XXXX ) at the call center ( XXXX XXXX in XXXX ) was very rude because, even though I gave him ALL my personal information, I could not verify the account number because I no longer had the card ( I destroyed it back in XXXX ).

Two weeks later, I received a notice that my Citibank account was sold to a collection agency ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). I called Citibank back about the pending dispute and they would not discuss it with me or confirm they had any record of my previous calls. I called XXXX 'XXXX Collection branch XXXX  and, once explaining my situation to the woman, she said she understood and would mark the case as a disputed claim and that I would get a follow up from them within 2-4 weeks with instructions as to how and where to submit the dispute information. Instead, I got another notice in XXXX asking " how can we help '' you with a payment schedule. Another phone call, another explanation and another registering a dispute. XX/XX/XXXX, I get a letter from XXXX  with a copy of the Citibank letter saying they sold the account but nothing from Citibank referring to any dispute discussions I had with them. This is the first piece of mail or communication where I am actually privy to the account number that was assigned to me over a year ago. Finally my credit rating has been changed to " in dispute '' but there should be no issues with my normally outstanding credit rating if not for this account. 
Issues : - I never authorized the use of this account anywhere in writing or with signature. 
-the credit card was never activated - XXXX ignored my request to NOT renew my XXXX account - XXXX renewed my membership without my approval on a credit card that was not activated - Citibank was no help in resolving the situation and " sold '' my account to a collection agency within 1-2 weeks of receiving my call for a dispute resolution - Citibank refuses to talk to me about an account that no longer exists with them - Citibank refused my request for a transcript or even acknowledgement that our phone calls transpired even though " this call may be monitored ... ''

Navient continues to send me emails about the payment they expect from me in XXXX. They claim that my school didn't report to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. I logged into the database and it says that I am a full-time student. Therefore, there is no reason they should be sending me emails expecting payment. Their website gives you the run around when it comes to filing forms online and contacting them by email. They say if you log in you can email them. It becomes one giant circle of going around from page to page without finding the information you are entitled to. 

They keep everything under wraps and do not inform their customers of anything. This is predatory student lending or debt collection at this point. My student status was updated on XX/XX/2019. There is NO REASON they should be asking me for payment now. But they are and I'm sick to death of their terrible customer service and harassment. If they aren't doing their job and checking the database, then that's not my issue. Something needs to be done about this. They have helped my old school to rip people off, they took my money and I got nothing in return but they still have these loans. It's bad enough I have to go back to college to try and get where I should have been in the first place.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2018, I used the XXXX XXXX app to transfer {$200.00} from my XXXX XXXX checking account ( debit card ) to my sisters XXXX XXXX   account. As of today, XX/XX/XXXX, the transaction still shows pending. The recipient ( my sister ) has still not received the funds. We have made four phone calls to XXXXXXXX XXXX, each call taking between XXXX minutes to XXXX hours, and each time have been told it will be another XXXX hours for XXXX XXXX   engineering team to fix the problem in their system. Today, I was on the phone for XXXX minutes and was told yet again they are working to fix the problem but cant tell me when. In my mind, XXXX has stolen not only my money but also my time which is of even greater value at this point than the formentioned funds. XXXX XXXX needs to be shut down. They are misleading consumers and are not able to live up to their terms of agreement. After XXXX weeks, I label this as theft and fraud.

Ms. XXXX called me XX/XX/XXXX, trying to collect a debt from XX/XX/XXXX. She would not verify herself, her company, and she did not verify me. She did not read the " this is an attempt to collect a debt '' nor was i on a recorded line. If i was on a recorded line, she did not notify me. She told me I had ONE hour to pay. I told her I needed time and needed to research this before paying. She then somehow called my boss 's mobile phone, was rude to her, and this was extremely embarrassing to me at my place of work. When I called her back ( I called her on an XXXX number, she answered " hello '', she did not answer with a business name ) to tell her it is illegal to contact my boss, and it is also illegal the way she handled the entire call. She became irate, unprofessional, and told me to " quit stealing money and I should know better '' then she became threatening, and told me to " just wait '' There are SEVERAL Fair Debt Collection Act violations in this scenario, and I can not find any information on " XXXX XXXX '' there is also a XXXX number she has called from.

I attended XXXX XXXX University from the fall of XXXX to the spring of XXXX and graduated with a BS in XXXX XXXX. After graduation I accepted an industry position and began my new career in XXXX of XXXX. After an automatic deferment of six months on my loan repayment I entered an income-based repayment ( IBR ) plan that allowed me to make payments while supporting my wife and twin sons, all without incident. When it was time to renew my XXXX in XXXX I followed the same process but my payment status was left unresolved for several months despite regular attempts to contact the company to resolve the matter. By XX/XX/XXXX I was receiving notices that Navient required payment but would not accept my XXXX application with no explanation as to why there was an issue. By approximately XXXX of XXXX my IBR was approved and I began payments again, but Navient had placed XXXX day late payment marks on my credit report during the time that my payment plan was in process. I worked with the credit reporting agency and Navient to resolve the issue, and eventually Navient agreed that my lack of payment was due to process errors on their end, but for some reason they have only removed the marks for the 30 and 60 day late payments on my XXXX report. Please see the attached document showing a 90 day late payment in XX/XX/XXXX but ( document titled 'XXXX Navient Payment, ' red highlight from me ) but no payment issues on XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. I have been unable to retrieve documents from either XXXX or Navient showing the previous status, but credit reports don't generally show a random 90 day late payment mark in an otherwise satisfactory payment history. I have contested the 90 day late payment several times with both XXXX and Navient, while the XXXX staff have been friendly they appear to be unable to do anything more than contact Navient as part of the dispute and receive a form letter that says that late payments have to be noted on credit reports. Please see the attached document labeled 'Navient Form Letter ' for the last of these letters I received from Navient while disputing on my credit report. That is literally all of the contact I have been able to document from their organization. At this point I can't even log into their system to find historical documents and can't receive customer assistance in any form.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
At the beginning of XX/XX/2019 I pulled all three credit reports and found two issues on them that tanked my credit score. One account is not even mine, the other was paid off and closed years ago. I first disputed on-line with no success. They returned results that stated " all information correct and verified with reporting company ''. I then did a little research on how to have errors removed from your credit report, as well as spoke to an attorney that advised me to send certified letters to both companies asking that the accounts be verified with proof of that verification. One company ( A collection Agency ) refused the letter, the other sent me a response that said they had verified the information with the credit bureaus and was not required to provide any proof to me other than they verified my identity on this credit card ON-LINE. So apparently crooks don't open accounts on-line???!!! 
So I filed WRITTEN disputes to all three Credit Bureaus, sent them all Certified Mail, and just received a response from XXXX stating once again regarding the same account - " Information verified with reporting agency '' and nothing more. That's it??? Of course the reporting agency is going to " confirm '' that their information is correct, but don't they need to provide some sort of PROOF other than their word?!!!!! What more can I do as a consumer to have this addressed/investigated properly??? 
The other account that I am disputing flat out refused to accept the letter that I sent them certified. Now what? I've filed written dispute as well on this response, but have not gotten a response yet from any of the Credit Bureaus. 
I need assistance immediately in addressing XXXX  and their investigation processes. Both these items need to be removed immediately as neither of them have provided any type of proof/verification of accounts.

I have been contacted repeatedly by the company, Asset Recovery Services. They have informed me that if I do not pay the debt that they claim I owe then civil lawsuit action will take place.They claim that this debt is over seven years old and when I inform them that they can not legally sue me for this debt they become increasingly agitated and unprofessional. They have claimed that they will come to my place of business but have not stated their intentions for that. I have requested that all communication be in writing and to no longer call me and they have refused this request. I have attached an email, the only thing in writing that I have received so far. In this email our discussion is referenced and the term settlement is used. At no time did I admit to ownership of the debt nor did I agree to pay any amount.

I have one existing Capital One Card. About 2 years ago, I called the credit card company and asked them to lower my Interest rate. I believe that my credit score was in the mid-700 's. At that time, I had two Capital One cards and had paid off these cards a few time with large sums of money paid. I believe that this company has been discriminating against me for some time. When they refused to lower the Interest rate the first time, I had that Bank canceled one of my cards. After I canceled that card, I began to get harassed by this bank in regards to my online activity where I would pay the amount owed. The Credit Card online account on numerous time had my password being changed, and I had to wait long periods to get it taken care of. I filed a Banking Complaint against them more than once. What can you do to assist me?

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I once had a joint credit card with my now ex-husband ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) with XXXX   and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, PA. Per our marital settlement agreement filed in XX/XX/XXXX in XXXX County, PA, my name was to be removed from this account in some manner by him upon our divorce ( which was granted in XX/XX/XXXX ; see attachments ). Currently, my Equifax credit report shows this account as having closed in XX/XX/XXXX. However, I recently noticed that my credit scores dropped considerably, due to the creditor having reported a negative change in the account 's payment status and an increase in the balance. For example, per XXXX XXXX, my XXXX  decreased by 41 points on XX/XX/XXXX due solely to the increased balance of this account ( see attachment ). 

I filed a dispute about this information in early XX/XX/XXXX with XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX. The first two credit reporting agencies have closed my dispute and have made no change to my report, claiming that the account information is correct. I simply don't understand how this is possible -- my name has been removed from this account per court order and the credit bureaus themselves all list this account as closed. I do not bear any responsibility for this account as of the date of my granted divorce decree, and yet both XXXX and Equifax have refused to remove this negative item from XX/XX/XXXX from my credit report.

On or around XX/XX/XXXX I received a call from XXXX at C & M Associates claiming to be trying to collect a debt from a credit card from XXXX. I was threatened with a law suit, liens on my home and bank account. I got angry and he hung up on me. I felt bad so the next day I called this company back and spoke with a gentleman named XXXX XXXX I explained to him that I did not have the money to settle this debt, in the amount of XXXX, so I was offered a settlement amount of XXXX which I thought was something I could do given some time. XXXX asked me if I could pay XXXX and that would lock in the settlement amount, and that I would have until XX/XX/XXXX to pay the remaining balance of XXXX. I reluctantley gave him my checking account information, stating to him that I was not comfortable doing so, he promised me that no other monies would be taken out of my account without my ok. I was told that he would keep in touch to see where I was financially. I spoke with XXXX again on XX/XX/XXXX at which time I was thinking that I would have the money in the bank, but was not 100 % sure ... so he said he would call me the day before it was due, which would've been XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX had contacted me, at which time I told him that I did not have the money in my account, he informed that by not settling this case I would be sued, I would have a lien on my home, on my bank account ... and I told him that unfortunately I would have to take that chance I had not realized that they money had already been deducted from my account ... he acted as though he had no idea. On XX/XX/XXXX a deposit had been made into my account, which I was using for my mortgage payment. Low and behold that on XX/XX/XXXX I went to the ATM to make a small withdrawal, it was rejected stating there were insufficient funds, I then looked at my account on my phone and saw that on XX/XX/XXXX a payment of XXXX was withdrawn and sent to C & M Associates. I was livid, this left my account with XXXX in it, which in turn my house payment bounced. I called XXXX at C & M Associates and he told me that is what my agreement was, that I was told that the payment was due on the XXXX, and that I postdated the checking information for that day. I told him that I did no such thing, I told XXXX on the XXXX that I would not have the money for XX/XX/XXXX. Therefore they took the money out of my account without permission, they stole my money ... .I have tried to email them, but it comes back stating access denied ... ..I am at wits end. I have contacted the District Atttorney 's office in XXXX County. I have also filed a complaint with the XXXX ... ..I will pursue charges if forced too.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: OnXX/XX/2019 I pulled my XXXX  credit report. I noticed two collections on my report from a Phoenix Financial Group a collection agency claiming to be collecting for a XXXX XXXX XXXX. One was for {$160.00} and one was for {$160.00}. I was completely unaware of owing any of these two groups any money for any services provides. I disputed these on my credit report and on the next morning XX/XX/2019 I called XXXX XXXX XXXX and they could not find anything on me owing them any money that had not been paid. I then contact Phoenix Financial Group and the lady insisted on me giving her my social security number. I was hesitant but she stated she could not look up anything with out it. So I did and she told me she could not find anything in her system that they had reported. I asked well why is there two collections on my credit report. She just stated on don't know. dispute it. I then asked her if she would send me an email that stated they have no collections reported on me. She stated send you an email that I have nothing in my system or in the office on you and I said yes. She just laughed and said she could not do that. Here is a group that is unconcerned that they have fraudulently posted a negative entry on someone's credit report and had no desire to correct the mistake.

XXXX XXXX bought my mortgage and i can not log into my account through their website. I previously filed CFPB complaint number XXXX and received an inadequate response. It stated that since they can log into my account i can too and i don't have a problem. This is comical because i would hope a company servicing billions in home mortgages can log into their own software account ; however, just because they can log in doesn't mean i can. I have called the respondent o my complaint, XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX compliance department have have received no call back from multiple voice messages.

XXXX College is known as a scammer school that shut its doors on its students and left everyone in debt. 

I transferred out of XXXX College a year before it closed down due to the fact that I didnt believe they had given me the education they promised, they didnt train me properly, and they promised I would be finished in 2 years, which I absolutely wasnt. Nor was any of my peers. 

A year later they were shut down and I am stuck paying back {$100000.00} in student loan debt with no degree or certificate to show for it. I am struggling to make ends meet while still trying to get an education at a better school. 

I believe it is completely unfair that I was promised a good education by a scam school that eventually closed down and forgave the student loans of the students currently at the school. I was smart enough to leave to not accrue MORE debt, however, I am still paying back the loans caused by this school. 

I would like forgiveness of my loans from XXXX College or a giant percentage taken off at a better rate so I can pay back at least some and get this horrible school off my of record and off of my mind.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX I sent a wire for XXXX XXXX from my Wells Fargo bank in Georgia ref. numberXXXX to an agent who worked for XXXX XXXX XXXX who were sending a consignment ( to one XXXX XXXX ) from out of the country. The agents name was foreign sounding XXXX XXXX and I knew nothing about him except that I was to go through him for XXXX XXXX to get his consignment so XXXX XXXX could pay me back the previous loans he had gotten from me. The day the wire was sent it was confiscated by US Treasury Dept. specially the OFAC ( a terrorist division ). They have held the money since then. They demanded to know XXXX XXXX 's passport, id, etc on this man I was told worked for XXXX. I could tell them nothing. I have been making huge payments per mo. on this loan account numberXXXX of {$720.00}. and still owe over $ 30k. My bank told me I would get the money back with interest but it has not happened. They tell me they can not help me any further. I have written 6 letters and made calls to the XXXX but they do not respond. I need my money back so I can pay off this loan. Also XXXX XXXX has disappeared into the ether and I realize he has been using me in all this via a romance scam on the internet. 

I am a retired XXXX yr. old woman with a small pension and can not afford a lawyer. I need someone to intervene for me. Please please help me. My cell is XXXX and my address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Ga XXXX. I have filed a sherriff report with my county. about XXXX XXXX.

My refinance took longer than expected. Flagstar charged me 3 times @ {$30.00} for payoff quotes that I did not request. To the extent I did request quotes, I did them by mail to avoid their excessive and unfair fax/electronic fees. My presumption is the request came from the title company, but Flagstar did not reach out to me prior to fulfilling the payoff request to gauge whether there was a rush need that required electronic versus mail. Instead, they fulfilled these electronically and charged me a fee. This is an unfair and deceptive practice when it is cheaper to generate electronic payoffs than it costs to mail. I have no way to prevent it from occurring as I am not the source of the request. Moreover, I wonder if Flagstar provides payoff figures to their internal sales team when their customers refinance with Flagstar rather than a competitor. 

In speaking with Flagstar, they were unconcerned with this practice and told me to take it up with the title company that incurred the costs on my behalf. 

Separately, I tried to reach Flagstar in XXXX to talk about Loss Draft funds related to Irma, but they'd switched insurance vendors. There was no one available to talk to me after repeated attempts. They took my number and never returned my calls.

I took a refinance mortgage with Quicken Loans Inc on a condo unit I owned in XXXX about two years ago. I was making a payment of {$620.00} a month. On XX/XX/2019 I received an email notifying me that my taxes on that property were paid, which was odd because I always receive the bill from the City and pay my taxes. I contacted Quicken Loans via email and they told me that they received an undelivered mail from the city that prompted them to establish the escrow on my account and pay the taxes and also increase my monthly mortgage payment. I told them that bill must have crossed in the mail and I also told them that I went ahead and made the payment in full on the taxes on the city website. I provided them the receipts of the payment via email as asked them to removed the escrow as it will mess up my online banking. I provided them the contact number of the City of XXXX and told them that the clerk confirmed to me that Quicken could verify my payment with a phone call. All they need is the account number associated with the property. They got back to me and said they could not do this and the escrow will remain on my account because they have the right to establish it. I asked them to put my account in dispute and to provide me with the proof that they have the right to establish an escrow account and increase my monthly payment without my knowledge but they never did. I also ask them to provide me with the agency they use for arbitration but they got back to me and said there is no process to dispute this via arbitration or any other way. A few weeks later I started to receive late notices stating that I was delinquent on my loan even though I was making my regular $ XXXX monthly payment 30 days in advanced and I have never been late. This payment was automatically setup from my bank account to go 30 days before the due date and it is still going out every month. 
I tried several channels including calls, emails to try to resolve this issue but no one at Quicken seems to make any effort to resolve this issue. Quicken has been reporting me as delinquent every month since XX/XX/2019 because of the shortage from the escrow account they established. My credit score dropped more than 100 points when Quicken started to report me as delinquent. They also keep charging me every month a late payment and sending me notices of foreclosure on my condo.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I am an American expatriate living in XXXX XXXX and working for a XXXX XXXX XXXX. My employer recently changed direct deposit policies so that the balance of my monthly pay was sent directly to my XXXX bank account rather than my U.S. bank account. Knowing that this change was about to occur, I set-up international wire-transfer instructions with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX ), and sent a test transfer to to XXXX XXXX, XXXX to ensure that my data was correct. Within 36 hours my test was successful and I was confident that I had provided proper information to the bank. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX I received documentation that my request to remove my cosigner was denied for " insufficient income for amount of credit requested ''. For a number of reasons I believe this determination is unjust and inappropriate for my current financial situation and the current guidelines in place by XXXX XXXX to remove a cosigner. No where in the application does it state that I must have a certain dollar amount of income yearly to be approved for the cosigner to be removed, even with that being said I make a very decent amount of income for my age and debt- very easily making monthly payments. According the cosigner release form the guidelines to be met are of the following : I must complete the entire application, which I did. I must meet the age requirement of 18, which I have. Provide graduation completion documentation, which I did. Be a US Citizen, which I am and forever will be. Provide proof of income, I provided my recent pay stub along with my W2- with a very reasonable income. Be current on my service loans and with in the past 12 months, which I have been in repayment for over a year now and have never missed a payment. The next is demonstrated a satisfactory payment history for the last 12 months. And finally no student loans in hardship or forbearance, which I have never had. They did state they would run a credit report the support the fact that I will be able to assume full responsibility for repayment of loans and to make sure there are no signs of bankruptcy, open foreclosure, student loan default or delinquencies. So at meeting all these guidelines and applying, I had no concerns of having my application not being accepted. Then when I received the form on XX/XX/XXXX stating my income was unsatisfactory, I strongly disagreed. On XX/XX/XXXX I requested a form from transunion to dig further into why I may have  not been accepted. The same time I had called and spoke to XXXX XXXX about it and the representative told me that I had no grounds to dispute the subject. I am currently awaiting a response from TransUnion on the grounds that they used my old income to calculate the report versus the W2 I had submitted. I have a decent credit score and steady income, currently I have no assistance from the cosigner on my loans and am making payments in full.

Recently I purchased a property and locked the loan through PNC Bank XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX ( Mortgage Loan Officer ) - NMLS ID : XXXX. I quoted the loan with XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/2018 and he promised it can be closed on XX/XX/XXXX. I thought it is perfect timing because my lease ending date is XX/XX/2018. However, it is a mistake to decide to work with XXXX and XXXX. Their irresponsible promise and carelessness service made me into very stressful situation and caused me a loss of {$960.00}. 

Starting XX/XX/XXXX I begin to submit materials requested. The loan processor I worked with is XXXX XXXX, NMLS # XXXX. For any materials he requested, I submitted to him promptly. He promised the close date is XX/XX/2018 until XX/XX/2018, he told me because the confirmation of my XXXX status, he could only submit he project review on XX/XX/2018 and my loan would be delayed to be closed on XX/XX/2018. 

At that time, I already give notice to the landlord which means I must move into the property on XX/XX/2018. 

However, I trusted him I can still move into the property though it is inconvenient to me. In addition, my parents is visiting me from XXXX and we planned to be on vacations during holidays. 

After that, he kept on telling me everything is on track and we would be close on time until XX/XX/XXXX, he disappeared. He responded the next day and told me the bank wouldnt close the loan and the bank would not be responsible for any expense of hotel. He kept on lying to me he could cancel the loan or the loan would be close on this date and that date. 

Because his dereliction of duty, I have to pay {$120.00} a day to live in hotel for a total of {$960.00}. 

The delay ruined my entire holiday plan. I canceled the trips to south California because the loan wouldnt be closed. I would not go with PNC if they have told me the timeline in the first place. I think the whole practice is against UDAAP. 

Besides, XXXX promised to provide the project review copy but he did not. He again lied to me.

They had no legal grounds to come after me personally for a debt under an LLC. They had no legal grounds to pierce the vale of limited liability. A quick search online will show the amount of complaints and unlawful tactics the firm uses to scare people into giving them money. 

I have also not received any notifications about payments being processed or that the debt is paid off, which it should be. This firm is out of control and using predatory and illegal tactics to scare people into paying them.

My last payment was made in XXXX and was only {$26.00} because we had paid so much down already. They basically explained that even though the last payment of {$26.00} was not due until several days after it was received ( I paid it before the due date ), the 12 months no interest program expired a few days before the payment was actually due. So basically I got charged over {$570.00} for a {$26.00} final payment that was paid early. I have excellent credit and strive to always pay my bills on time. I have never filed a complaint or had an issue with a 12 month no interest arrangement. This was extremely deceptive. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Under Rule 5000 FDIC guidelines, a debt can be classified under two options, standard and sub-standard. Sub-standard debts are debts placed into a charge off status, and that takes place on secured debts as posting for 180 days late. As this dispute proves, the dent showing as a charge off status has never been more that 60-days late. Accordingly, the charge off status is fraudulent, and must be removed. XXXX XXXX XXXX has an obligation under its subscriber agreement with the three major credit bureaus to abide by the rules under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and the guidelines under the FDIC Act, which gives strict guidelines pertaining to sub-standard debts and charge off status requirements. The charge off status must be deleted permanently.

I have tried for months to work with FedLoan Servicing to rectify this issue, but I am very unhappy with the progress of this review. Both the Department of Education Ombudsman Group and Fed Loan verbally confirmed the payments I made over the telephone, but they refuse to submit this to me in writing. Fedloan has sent me 3 different cryptic, disorganized documents that do not in any way show a full payment history, and they truly lack any semblance of reason. One document had transaction codes with no legend/key for the codes and 50-75 different transactions, many in the amount of {$0.00} or other random small amounts. This is completely unacceptable service for a student loan company to offer a borrower. 

Furthermore, FedLoan has advised me that nearly a year of payments I made in XXXX cant be counted toward PSLF because I was on an " administrative forbearance '' at this time. I have proof that I was billed during this time, made hefty monthly payments, and I did not request any type of forbearance on my account for those months. I would have never made the financially crippling payments if they weren't being counted toward my loan program! This is obviously an administrative error and must be corrected. 

Fedloan has also advised me that some payments I made could not be counted toward PSLF because my payment was one cent off from the actual amount due. I have sent them records showing that my monthly amount due was indeed the amount I paid. A few other payments were a XXXX or a few dollars off because I paid a few dollars extra on a month prior when I would sometimes round up to the nearest dollar when making a payment. Beyond this, there were several other payments that Fedloan says do not count towards the PSLF program for one unfair reason or another. I work in public service, and I have struggled to make these payments. I've paid around {$30000.00} of interest only payments to date. My original loan balance was around {$47000.00} ... with compounding interest each month, my balance has increased to {$60000.00}. My only hope for ever ending this overwhelming debt is the PSLF program. Fedloan is making unfair, inhumane decisions with regard to PLSF and it is very evident that they've grossly mismanaged my student loans. I have never made a late payment and have held up my end of the contract as the consumer. Fedloan has breached the contract with me, the loan holder, by not keeping proper records of my payment eligibility, and by never informing me that being paid ahead by even a XXXX could affect my status. ( This information is buried on their website, but in the emails I get each month about my bill it actually gives encouraging tips about paying ahead! ) Furthermore, it is completely unacceptable to not fulfill my request for a full payment history in 3 months time when I am currently making monthly payments in the amount of over {$410.00} to this company! 

I have followed the PSLF program to the letter, frequently certifying my employment for the program. Ive read online about people who werent with the right loan servicer for PSLF, or in the wrong payment plan for years and who are now upset that their payments dont count and have appealed for inclusion in the program. Meanwhile, I did my research and properly followed the program, only to have XXXX instruction or accountability from XXXX XXXX and then my payments mishandled and incorrectly counted by FedLoan! This program is supposed to reward people for work in the public sector. Its become a cryptic, unfair game that is impossible to navigate and has resulted in an insurmountable level of debt! I have a young son, and our entire future rests on me completing this program as soon as possible. I have already been working with the FedLoan Ombudsman group for 3 months. The staff is abrasive and unsympathetic. Please help me rectify this injustice and help me communicate with this organization.

3-4 years ago my mortgage was sold by XXXX to a company called Seterus. Since then I have so many payment problems. My bank has sent them a mortgage payment 2x,  both occasions the payment was never received!! I get hit immediately with penalties. I have paid several times through their online payment system, again these payments failed and I got hit by penalties. Always penalties. The only way to pay my mortgage is to actually call them up every month and authorise same day debit from my account. Always so many extra fees ... I have reached out through social media and found hundreds of people suffering the same way. 

We now realise that Seterus are scammers, just looking to frustrate mortgage holders to screw extra fees every month. This is a consumer racket, and the public is being fleeced. I am a member of this XXXX page - https : XXXX. Please investigate them, they are fraudsters

The complaint I have is two fold. Everyone I worked with redirected to someone else. I have emails upon emails regard people telling me to go to different people up until this point I have been told that I don't qualify for a modification because I have only been in my property under a year. I will be calling and writing Washington BECAUSE what has happened to me is CRIMINAL and I WONT lose my home due to negligence. I have phone conversations, emails and texts of me asking for help or trying to understand the process all on my own. My ISSUE is I was told that there was assistane to help cover my living expenses during the XXXX process but I was NEVER told the request for these funds needs to be included in the work scope prior to closing. I am in a financial crisis now which partly my fault because I tried my best to handle this on my own. I havr maxed out ALL my credit cards. My credit is ruined and as a result of late fees and insurance increasing I can't afford to pay my mortgage. I'm in the process of applying for the HOME SAVER Grant and I really hope they can help me. It's sad and stressful but I know someone can help me I just have to keep looking and writing and start to hold people accountable ( this includes me ) for there actions. Please help me save my home.
